data.text: @KeithMEWAS Notice how the US is #2 yet many states are lifting their mask mandates… unreal. It’s too early for that imo

@KeithMEWAS @Heathenmomma1 No, you got it completely backwards and inside out. It is the definition of "Covid-deaths" that causes confusion. Sweden measures died-with-covid (30d since diagnose) so wipe the dust from your books on maths/probability and try again....

@JonMur78 @kirstenzerbinis It is mind-boggling. And of course, you cannot compare when the stats are inconsistent, no testing of the public any longer, thousands died in the first wave without being tested, and those that die 30 days after testing positive are not counted as C19 deaths. Pure gaslighting.
@KeithMEWAS @kirstenzerbinis But it's still early, we must compare Sweden in about 50 years and see if the Swedish strategy worked or not.

@kirstenzerbinis Absolutely. And the Swedish gov and health authority kept saying let's compare Sweden to other countries in 6-months, a year etc. You cannot compare Sweden to any other country because the data is so manipulated and inconsistent. And they have not tested the public for weeks.

@KeithMEWAS I can definitely believe that. And not counting c19 deaths after 30 days is crazy, everyone is seeing that omicron is milder onset, and deaths happen later. It’s so hard to not have good information!
@Heathenmomma1 The way it is calculated in Sweden is a shambles and proven to be so.

@KeithMEWAS 🤷
Excess mortality in Europe during 2020-2021. https://t.co/n3S5hoD7DG
@KeithMEWAS Unbelievable! And covid is not even considered dangerous in Sweden from April! Why don't people wonder why so many people are dying if omicron is so "mild"?
@maskupsweden @KeithMEWAS @Folkhalsomynd Please note... 🙄 (autocorrected before i switched to the English editor)
